name: Falafel With Black Olives and Harissa
description: When I first completed my recipe for falafel, my first thought was "That's great—now how do we make it hotter?" That thought was immediately followed by some digging through the refrigerator for condiments, mixing them into batches of my raw falafel dough to see how they'd taste. I settled on harissa, the North African spice paste.
recipeIngredient: 3 tablespoons (45ml) fresh harissa paste or store-bought harissa paste
3 ounces pitted black olives (about 1/2 cup; 85g), roughly chopped
Tahini sauce, hummus, and/or zhug (Yemenite hot sauce) for serving

recipeInstructions.text: Complete Easy, Herb-Packed Falafel recipe through the end of step 2. Add harissa and black olives to falafel mixture and fold in gently with a rubber spatula. Continue cooking falafel as directed, starting with step 3. Serve with zhug or tahini sauce.
